etymologies: early 17th century (denoting a magistrate in certain ancient Greek states): via ecclesiastical Latin from Greek dēmiourgos ‘craftsman’, from dēmios ‘public’ (from dēmos ‘people’) + -ergos ‘working’

definitions: a being responsible for the creation of the universe.
shortDefinitions: being responsible for creation of universe

definitions: (in Platonic philosophy) the Maker or Creator of the world.
shortDefinitions: (in Platonic philosophy) Maker or Creator of world

definitions: (in Gnosticism and other theological systems) a heavenly being, subordinate to the Supreme Being, that is considered to be the controller of the material world and antagonistic to all that is purely spiritual.
shortDefinitions: (in Gnosticism and other theological systems) heavenly being, subordinate to Supreme Being, that is considered to be controller of material world
